Hi Bonnie,

Hope you're having a great week!

We've made the necessary updates for the Dewalt Warranty form. Please check below and let us know your feedback.

👉 https://mayohardware.com.au/dewalt/dewalt-warranty-claim-petrol-pressure-washer/

action.text: Allie Borcena moved this conversation from the Wolf IQ inbox

full_threads.body:
Hi Bonnie,

We really appreciate your quick feedback.

Our team will work on this and we’ll get back to you early next week once it’s all completed.

Have a lovely weekend!

Hi Joy, Thanks a lot for your help so far. A few tweaks: The updated list of pressure washers has not been applied. Missing the models mentioned in my previous email:
  • DXPW3194XE - 3100PSI Petrol DeWalt
  • DXPW3400SC - 3400PSI Petrol DeWalt With S/Cleaner and Turbo Nozzle
  • DXPW3595XE - 3500PSI Petrol With S/Cleaner and Turbo Nozzle
This issue has not been resolved: Fault Type: It starts but then shuts down P2-Q1
  • When "Yes" is selected, it should take you to the next question. It currently does nothing
  • When "No" is selected, it should say "Check the oil and fill if required". It is currently showing the next question and needs to be fixed
While this issue was resolved, the questions that follow are incorrect. I have listed the corrections below and highlighted in green: Fault Type: It is leaking water
  • When selected, the below questions result in saying "Physical damage is not covered by warranty. While it most cases it can be repaired, the customer will have to pay for these repairs". They should show the next question
    • Q1: Where the garden hose connects to the pressure washer
      • P3-Q2-1 Question should read: Is there any physical damage to the connections or the pump?
        • P3-Q3-1 When "Yes" is selected
          • "Looks like your pressure washer needs to be sent to a DeWalt Authorised Service Agent. Please complete the below and one of the Mayo team will be in contact with you shortly."
    • Where the high-pressure hose connects to the pressure washer
      • P3-Q2-1 Question should read: Is there any physical damage to the connections or the pump?
        • P3-Q3-1 When "Yes" is selected
          • "Looks like your pressure washer needs to be sent to a DeWalt Authorised Service Agent. Please complete the below and one of the Mayo team will be in contact with you shortly."
    • Where the high-pressure hose connects to the spray gun
      • P3-Q2-1 Question should read: Is there any physical damage to the connections or the spray gun?
        • P3-Q3-1 When "Yes" is selected
          • "Looks like your pressure washer needs to be sent to a DeWalt Authorised Service Agent. Please complete the below and one of the Mayo team will be in contact with you shortly."
    • Where the lance connects to the spray gun
      • P3-Q2-1 Question should read: Is there any physical damage to the lance or spray gun?
        • P3-Q3-1 When "Yes" is selected
          • "Looks like your pressure washer needs to be sent to a DeWalt Authorised Service Agent. Please complete the below and one of the Mayo team will be in contact with you shortly."
    • Where the nozzle connects to the lance
      • P3-Q2-1 Question should read: Is there any physical damage to the lance or nozzle?
        • P3-Q3-1 When "Yes" is selected
          • "Looks like your pressure washer needs to be sent to a DeWalt Authorised Service Agent. Please complete the below and one of the Mayo team will be in contact with you shortly."
Let me know if you have any questions! Thank you Bonnie Sudirwan Marketing Communications Manager bsudirwan@mayohardware.com.au http://www.mayohardware.com.au/ 0408 331 966 Customer Service: 1300 360 211 CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This e-mail message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information or otherwise be protected by law. Any unauthorised review, use, disclosure or distribution is prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply e-mail and destroy all copies of the original message.
(Time: 160mins) Dev+ QA+ Admin time

Rest assured, I'll keep you posted on our progress.

Hi Joy, The contact info for all forms is correct now. The next issue we need to work on is the flow of the questions. They are currently broken and a little bit backwards. We will start with petrol pressure washers as it is the most used form. Here is the template that shows the work flow and how each question should respond depending on the answer - Warranty Checklist V1 24.03.24.xlsx Fault Type: It won't start P1-Q1
  • When "Yes" is selected, it should take you to the next question. It currently does nothing
  • When "No" is selected, it should say "Check the oil and fill if required". It is currently showing an odd question and needs to be fixed
Fault Type: It starts but then shuts down P2-Q1
  • When "Yes" is selected, it should take you to the next question. It currently does nothing
  • When "No" is selected, it should say "Check the oil and fill if required". It is currently showing the next question and needs to be fixed
Fault Type: It is leaking water
  • When selected, the below questions result in saying "Physical damage is not covered by warranty. While it most cases it can be repaired, the customer will have to pay for these repairs". They should show the next question
    • Where the garden hose connects to the pressure washer
    • Where the high-pressure hose connects to the pressure washer
    • Where the high-pressure hose connects to the spray gun
    • Where the lance connects to the spray gun
    • Where the nozzle connects to the lance
P3-Q2-2
  • When "Yes" is selected, it should say "Physical damage is not covered by warranty. While it most cases it can be repaired, the customer will have to pay for these repairs". It currently does nothing
P3-Q3-2
  • This needs to be removed. It is a double up question
P3-Q4-2
  • This statement "Looks like your pressure washer needs to be sent to a DeWalt Authorised Service Agent. Please complete the below and one of the Mayo team will be in contact with you shortly." Should only show once "No" is selected
Fault Type: The water pressure is low
  • Only one statement should show which is dependent on what model was previously selected. It currently shows 3 different statements
Thanks Bonnie Sudirwan Marketing Communications Manager bsudirwan@mayohardware.com.au http://www.mayohardware.com.au/ 0408 331 966 Customer Service: 1300 360 211 CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This e-mail message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information or otherwise be protected by law.
